references.paper_title: A connectionist machine for genetic hillclimbing, volume 28
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of Bayesian Optimization and its connectionist approach influenced the development of related methods.

references.paper_title: High-dimensional discrete Bayesian optimization with self-supervised representation learning for data-efficient materials exploration
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of high-dimensional Bayesian optimization, which is highly relevant to real-world applications, and introduces a novel self-supervised approach to improve data efficiency.

references.paper_title: Fast Bayesian inference with batch Bayesian quadrature via kernel recombination
references.reason: This paper significantly improves the efficiency of Bayesian inference, a key component of Bayesian optimization, by using batch processing and kernel recombination.

references.paper_title: Adaptive batch sizes for active learning: A probabilistic numerics approach
references.reason: This paper introduces an adaptive approach to batch size selection in active learning, improving the efficiency and effectiveness of Bayesian optimization.

references.paper_title: Looping in the human: Collaborative and explainable Bayesian optimization
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant to the central theme of the current paper, as it explicitly addresses human-in-the-loop Bayesian optimization, providing valuable insights and methods.
